title: Survey Crew Chief/Survey Party Chief
description:
Who We Are

For over thirty years, SAM has built a reputation as a trusted, knowledgeable, and innovative partner. Our licensed professionals transform petabytes of complex spatial data into intelligent insights in a holistic Managed Geospatial Services™ (MGS™) framework. As North America's premiere MGS™ company, SAM provides practical, precise, and high-fidelity solutions designed to enhance decision-making, mitigate risks, achieve strategic objectives, and drive costs out of our client's business. Our vision is to advance spatial data acquisition, improve analysis capabilities, and develop predictive analytics to redefine and transform how infrastructure assets are developed and managed throughout their lifecycles.

Your Impact at SAM

As a Survey Crew Chief, you will be responsible for overseeing and conducting site control, ALTA, Boundary, Topography, and Construction Staking Surveys. This role has a strong focus in the commercial, utilities, transportation, and renewables industries and involves collecting accurate spatial data. You will oversee the daily field operations of a land survey crew, communicate with Project Surveyor's and Project Managers regarding projects schedule and work progress.

Determine most efficient plan of action for data acquisition for field surveys ranging from primary control through construction layout and as-built surveys, as neededProficient with documentation of work performed and sketchesInteract professionally with client representative and land ownersRead and interpret construction drawings/specifications and understand all aspects of the land survey project specifications and tolerancesPrepare daily reports, time sheets, and other required paperworkMaintain land surveying vehicle and field equipmentOther duties as assigned

What You Bring to SAM

5+ years of industry experience, prior crew chief experience is preferred Competent operating total stations, GNSS receivers, data collectors, and tablet PCsExperience with Trimble equipment is preferred Strong computer and technical skillsStrong communication skills (listening, writing and verbal)Proven work history, strong work ethic, and team-player attitudeAbility to travel for extended periodsAbility to work in all-weather climates Ability to walk long distances through a variety of terrains and carry up to 80lbsValid driver's license, clean background check and drug screening

Our Perks

Company paid premiums for medical, dental, vision, LTD and life insurance (HSA and FSA plans available)Generous paid time off (vacation, sick, holidays and parental leave) - Accrual starts immediately401(k) program offers 100% employer match up to 5%Paid continuing education courses and tuition reimbursementEmployee Assistance Program - Your mental health is our priorityNo glass ceiling! Truly a place to spread your wings (Ask about our Career Pathing!)Trainings throughout the year - Specialized in-house trainings programs designed to assist you in advancing in your careerOffice snacks, free food and fun-themed events for employees throughout the yearPassion for our Community - You have endless opportunities to volunteer alongside your peers with our Corporate Social Responsibility Program

Our Culture

Our entrepreneurial culture is a key factor in SAM being recognized as a Top Workplace for eleven consecutive years, and we make it our mission to ensure every one of our employees learns how to build and manage a business, not just be the subject matter expert on the team. At SAM, our employee’s development is instrumental to our success. Your learning will be supported by specialized in-house training programs and mentoring by the industry’s leading experts, who just happen to be on our staff! We make SAM a GREAT place to work, but it all starts with YOU!

EEO

SAM is an EOE/Affirmative Action Employer M/F/D/V. SAM also participates in the federal E-Verify Program.

title: Product Marketing Manager
description:
Do you like to work on cool tech in a creative environment? We do. If you're passionate about marketing and product management, love problem solving, and like calling the shots, join our team responsible for creating our next generation products!
Indyme is the world’s leading provider of customer engagement and anti-theft solutions to the rapidly evolving retail industry. Indyme’s systems are used by seven of the top ten U.S. retailers with more than 30,000 systems installed worldwide. Our customer list includes the who’s who of Tier I retailers with names like Target, Walmart, Home Depot, Lowe’s, Dick’s Sporting Goods, CVS, Walgreens, Albertsons, and Safeway to name a few. Our latest innovations include AI and machine learning, human behavior detection, and self-service locked case applications. In this critical role, you’ll be joining an entrepreneurial company where you can really build your skills and advance your career in a fun and empowering work environment.
About the positionIndyme is seeking a technically oriented product marketing manager. In this role as product marketing manager, you will take products from a loosely defined concepts, to a complete set of product requirements which will define the product’s features, functions, price points and go to market strategy. You will be the product owner throughout the development process.
To define the product requirements, you’ll meet with key retailers, visit stores and observe workflows, identify opportunities for innovation, understand the application and the value add, and translate that knowledge into a set of requirements for engineering to execute.
You will also negotiate with engineering to optimize for features and cost. Our retail customers are rapidly embracing new technologies as they continuously improve the customer experience and protect their merchandise from theft. You will be at the forefront of these new emerging trends as the company’s principal product marketing manager.
We are looking for local candidates; no relocation provided. We are not offering sponsorship for this position.
What you’ll do:Stay abreast of emerging technologies and help craft Indyme’s product strategy and roadmapCollect market intelligence on specific applicationsTranslate market and customer requirements into product definitionsWork collaboratively with engineering to work through tradeoffs needed to architect new productsFollow the product through product realization process to ensure features don’t drift from requirements

Skills you’ll needBS or MS in engineering or marketing or related work experienceMinimum of 4 years of relevant work experience in product marketing or product managementAbility to develop/conceptualize system requirementsDemonstrated understanding the product definition processExcellent writing skills to prepare requirements documentsAbility to work collaboratively in a cross-functional environment, working together with engineering to establish and meet product requirementsAbility to organize work priorities and interact effectively with other team members

title: Senior Trust Officer
description:
Major Job Function:Responsible for administration of personal trust accounts and new business development and acquisition.Experience/Skills necessary to perform duties: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience. Five to ten years of relevant experience in fiduciary administration and relationship management. CTFA or CFP certifications preferred. Proficiency in Microsoft Office, trust accounting software (AccuTrust), edocument management (Director), workflow forms (Unity), and related trust and investment systems. Excellent written and verbal skills. Adept with high touch communication with clients. Team player who possesses excellent judgment, initiative, and adaptability. Good intrapersonal relationship and service skills.
Regular Duties and Responsibilities:
Administration of assigned accounts includes, but not limited to: Respond to client visits, calls, emails, correspondence and other client requests. Administer the opening and closing of accounts. Account document preparation and review: Coordinate with client or client’s attorney to review trust or other fiduciary documents as to administrative feasibility & acceptance. Review incoming assets to determine acceptability, transferability, qualification, or disposition. Prepare, provide, or execute governing documents to open and administer the account. Set up and maintain client and account profile info in the trust system. Maintain account opening and closing checklists to confirm accuracy and completion of account set up or closing. Administer fiduciary accounts in compliance with the governing documents, and applicable federal and state laws and regulations. Prepare, complete, and present account reviews to verify proper administration to Trust Committee. Direct and approve receipts and disbursements for posting: checks, inter-account transfers, ACHs, and wires. Submit discretionary distribution requests for trust accounts. Coordinate with assigned investment advisors to determine and document investment objectives of the account. Monitor account cash balances to assure the investment of funds and the availability of funds for disbursement. Submit and approve trade requests as needed. Confirm completion and accuracy of transactions posted. Administer miscellaneous account assets: real estate, LLCs & partnerships, oil & gas, precious metals, etc. Pay property taxes and insurance; inspect real estate properties; obtain and update valuations of miscellaneous account assets in the trust system. Other duties as assigned.
Develop new business:
 Build and maintain a network with referral sources such as lawyers, CPAs, investment advisors, and other centers of influence. Respond to referrals from prospects, COIs, and internally. Make formal and informal presentations internally, to prospects, and to referral sources about fiduciary and investment services provided by the bank.

title: Propulsion Engineer III
description:
At Blue Origin, we envision millions of people living and working in space for the benefit of Earth. We’re working to develop reusable, safe, and low-cost space vehicles and systems within a culture of safety, collaboration, and inclusion. Join our diverse team of problem solvers as we add new chapters to the history of spaceflight! 

We are a diverse team of collaborators, doers, and problem-solvers who are relentlessly committed to a culture of safety. This position will directly impact the history of space exploration and will require your commitment and detailed attention towards safe and repeatable space flight. Join us in lowering the cost of access to space and enabling Blue Origin’s vision of millions of people living and working in space to benefit Earth.

This role is part of the Blue Origin Engines business unit, where our focus is the design, development, manufacturing and testing of engines and propulsion systems. Built for multiple uses, our family of engines is powering the next generation of rockets for commercial, civil, national security and human spaceflight.

In this position you will work directly with a small team, Engines Flight Support. EFS is a service center that supports our customer as they integrate, fly, and reuse Blue Origin’s engines. It will be your responsibility to support senior engineers and advise our customers, both internal and external, as they integrate our engines into the flight vehicle, verify the installation, and certify the installation for flight. Leading up to day-of-launch you will be part of a team that reports engine status at Mission and Flight Readiness Reviews and help to write, review, and execute launch procedures. You will provide engineering support in launch/mission control during flight, analyze flight data, participate in engine subsystem data reviews, and provide feedback on flight data results to the customer base, designers, and component owners for implementation into future engine upgrades.

In the scope of this role you will be expected to complete the certification process to sit on flight console representing the BE-3PM Engine. There is an expectation that after certification you will continue to support the team for at least a year beyond your certification date. To support post-flight engine refurbishment activities, you will assess hardware health and evaluate engine readiness for flight.

As part of this role, you will also support development of the specification that are used for engine integration into the flight vehicles, development of flight level ConOps, and be a general voice for the Engines group at the launch site.

If required, you will also support anomaly investigations, and assist functional managers in interviewing and hiring new talent. This position will directly impact the history of space exploration and will require your dedication, commitment, and detailed attention towards safe and repeatable spaceflight.

Aside from direct launch and flight support, you will serve as Engines point of contact for the vehicle customer, lead problem solving efforts, and assist in dispositioning non-conformances including on-site supervision of off-nominal field maintenance when required. As subject matter expert in launch vehicle and flight operations you will help establish standards to streamline the engine integration and checkout process to minimize schedule impacts and identify, communicate, and mitigate risks.

We are looking for someone to apply their technical expertise, leadership skills, and commitment to quality to positively impact safe human spaceflight. Passion for our mission and vision is required!

Qualifications

Minimum of a B.S. degree in aerospace/mechanical engineering or physicsAt least 5+ years experience in propulsion development, test, or launch/flight operations.Strong understanding and ability to apply engineering fundamentals including thermodynamics, fluid mechanics and structuresExperience with propulsion launch vehicle or engine test operations, from engine integration through mission operationsExperience in test or flight data analysisExperience with instrumentation such as pressure transducers, thermocouples, and accelerometersKnowledge of cryogenic propellants (liquid hydrogen, liquefied natural gas and liquid oxygen)Knowledge of engine components such as pumps, valves, regulators, actuators and other high pressure and cryogenic fluid system componentsAbility to identify and handle risks in a complex dynamic systemKnowledge of system engineering practicesDesire to work in a collaborative, fast paced, and multifaceted environmentStrong written and verbal communication skillsWillingness to travel to support flight and test activitiesAbility to earn trust, maintain positive and professional relationships, and strengthen our culture of inclusionMust be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.

Desired

Advanced degree in aerospace/mechanical engineering or physicsExperience with liquid rocket engine testing

Compensation range for on site WA applicants is $111,690-$156,366

Compensation range for on site CA applicants is $111,690-$156,366

Other Site Ranges May Differ

description:

This role is part of the Blue Origin Engines business unit, where our focus is the design, development, manufacturing and testing of engines and propulsion systems. Built for multiple uses, our family of engines is powering the next generation of rockets for commercial, civil, national security and human spaceflight.

As part of a small, passionate, and accomplished team of propulsion test engineers, you will help drive rocket engines test operations to meet Blue Origin’s launch vehicle program requirements for various spaceflight systems. You will directly contribute to engine test operations by assisting with test planning and execution, risk identification and mitigation, hardware integration for test campaigns, post-test inspections, data review, and engine performance analysis. This position will directly impact the history of space exploration and will require your dedicated commitment and detailed attention towards safe and repeatable spaceflight.

We are looking for someone to apply their technical expertise, leadership skills, and commitment to quality to positively impact safe human spaceflight. Passion for our mission and vision is required!

4-7 years of experience in a rocket engine testing or testing in an equivalent industryB.S. degree in engineering discipline (aerospace, mechanical, or physics desired)Experience in developing, producing, and executing test proceduresDemonstrated familiarity with data analysisWork on-site at test facilities at Launch Site One (LSO), Van Horn, TexasDemonstrated ability to lead projects and work independentlyStrong technical fundamentals in fluids and thermodynamicsOperational understanding of engines and engine sub-components, such as turbopumps, combustion devices, valves, and other fluid componentsAbility to read and interpret engineering standards, technical requirements, and engineering drawingsStrong written and verbal communication skillsAbility to earn trust, maintain positive and professional relationships, and contribute to a culture of inclusionMust be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.

title: Senior Materials & Processes Engineer - Turbomachinery & Forging
description:
At Blue Origin, we envision millions of people living and working in space for the benefit of Earth. We’re working to develop reusable, safe, and low-cost space vehicles and systems within a culture of safety, collaboration, and inclusion. Join our diverse team of problem solvers as we add new chapters to the history of spaceflight! 

We are a diverse team of collaborators, doers, and problem-solvers who are relentlessly committed to a culture of safety. Join us in lowering the cost of access to space and enabling Blue Origin’s vision of millions of people living and working in space to benefit Earth.

As part of a hardworking and accomplished team of experts, you will be responsible for Materials & Processes tasks related to Metallic forms (forgings and spun formed) used in Engine Turbomachinery. You will share in the team’s impact on all aspects of material characterization, supporting design for producibility, and new material development. This position will directly impact the history of space exploration and will require your dedicated commitment and detailed attention toward safe and repeatable spaceflight.

We are looking for someone to apply their technical expertise, leadership skills, and commitment to quality to positively impact safe human spaceflight. Passion for our mission and vision is required!

Responsibilities

Review Forged parts and large sophisticated assembly production drawingsOwn forged part design intent by collaborating with design, analysis, manufacturing, integration, and quality teams on the implementation of design requirements into productionOwn forged part qualification process by collaborating with suppliers, design, analysis, manufacturing, and quality functionsComplete Materials & Processes Engineering responsibilities on First Article Inspections, non-conformances, repairs, and continuous improvement projectsFind opportunities for new or improved material and process development, coordinate test campaigns, and provide program updates to IPTs. Own and update material specifications accordingly.Participate in the development of internal engineering and quality processes to standardize and accelerate material evaluation, implementation, and qualification procedures.

Qualifications

B.S. or higher degree in Materials Science & Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or related fieldAt least 8+ years of materials and processes engineering experience directly related to aerospace flight programs (level commensurate with experience)Experience with one or more of the material systems used in the aerospace industry (Ni-based alloys, Cu-based alloys, Al-based alloys, Ti-based alloys, oxygen-compatible alloys…)Expertise in at least one of the following processes: Forging, Spin Forming, Alloy Melting, Billet Conversion and associated processes (Heat Treat, NDE, etc)Experience with standard methods for testing mechanical properties (including fatigue, fracture, creep, stress rupture) of metallic materialsAbility to learn, grow and solve new challenges in a fast-paced environment.Ability to earn trust, maintain positive and professional relationships, and contribute to a culture of inclusion.Must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.Onsite Locations: Huntsville AL or Kent WA

Desired

Experience directly related to turbomachinery including material and process selection, development, scale up for manufacturability, production qualification and sustaining manufacturing supportDeep understanding of environmental and thermomechanical behavior of aerospace material systems at wide temperature ranges from cryogenic to elevatedProven experience on developing new aerospace processes, refining existing ones, running test plans for analysis and qualification of componentsExpertise with forging supplier engagement, while working through NPI process for forged hardware.Expertise with auditing forging and associated processes. Expertise in driving corrective actions.Hands-on skills with SEM, EDS, metallography, mechanical testingExperience with project management including tracking technical progress, managing resources and budgetExperience with failure and forensic analysis of aerospace hardwareExperience supporting design and manufacturing teams in an aerospace environment, including providing technical rationale for material and process related defects, publishing specifications, test reports, and design substantiation documentsKnowledge of industry standards for material data analysis (e.g. MMPDS)Understanding of aerospace quality standards and Quality Management Systems

title: Principal Development Lead for Maintenance - New Shepard
description:
At Blue Origin, we envision millions of people living and working in space for the benefit of Earth. We’re working to develop reusable, safe, and low-cost space vehicles and systems within a culture of safety, collaboration, and inclusion. Join our diverse team of problem solvers as we add new chapters to the history of spaceflight! 

This role is a part of New Shepard, a reusable suborbital rocket system designed to take astronauts and research payloads past the Kármán line, the internationally recognized boundary of space. Through operational reusability, New Shepard supports our mission of lowering the cost of access to space.

As part of a hardworking and diverse team of engineers, technicians and specialists, you will lead innovation in development of how we do maintenance, refurbishment, and preparations for all systems required for flight and recovery operations. You will work closely with New Shepard Operations and Maintenance to integrate newly developed technical products, ensure our certification is maintained, and define further evolutionary goals. You will work across Blue Origin programs, system elements, and the product lifecycle to enable new capabilities. We are looking for someone to apply their technical expertise, leadership skills, and dedication to quality to positively impact safe human spaceflight. Passion for our mission and vision is required!

Minimum Qualifications

Minimum of a B.S. degree in aerospace, mechanical, industrial, or manufacturing engineering; physics; or other major requiring engineering or manufacturing core courses10+ years of proven experience in operations and product developmentPrior experience with development of complex products and with launch operations and maintenance manual developmentKnowledge of fabrication, fielded product maintenance, integration processes, quality and configuration management systemsExcellent technical writing and verbal communication skillsAbility to earn trust, maintain positive and professional relationships, and contribute to our inclusive culture.Ability to travel to our West Texas Launch Facility approximately once per month

Preferred Qualifications

Masters of Science in Engineering or related fieldKnowledge of systems engineering practices and system safety analysis techniques as applied to human-integrated systemsAirframe & Powerplant license or experience working in a similar maintenance/refurbishment environmentDemonstrated experience in human transportation systemsProven experience with planning/scheduling tools including processes such as Basis Of Estimates and Integrated Master SchedulesExperience with maintenance management tools (ex. Maximo), project management tools (ex. Oracle Primavera P6, JIRA), and/or design tools (ex. CREO/Windchill)

title: SVP Sales & Business Development
description:
SVP Sales & Business Development
Job Summary: As we continue to expand our footprint and enhance our offerings, we are seeking a dynamic and strategic SVP of Sales and Business Development to lead our revenue generation efforts and drive growth through strategic business development deals and sales force optimization. Reporting to the CEO and part of the executive leadership team, you will be instrumental in shaping our revenue strategy, management/performance/ accountability of all sales personnel (national, regional and local) and forging strategic partnerships. You will play a critical role in driving revenue growth, expanding our market presence and sales strategy, act as voice of customer, and solidifying our position as a leader in the place based media/healthcare media/retail media. This position offers flexible work arrangements, allowing you to work remotely or from our Naperville, Illinois, Indianapolis, Indiana, or Oakland, CA office. Extensive travel, up to 30%, will be required throughout the year.
Essential Functions: 
1.Develop and Execute Revenue Strategy: Lead the development and execution of a comprehensive revenue generation strategy aligned with our business objectives and targets. Identify new revenue streams, market opportunities, and growth initiatives to drive sustainable revenue growth in both the static and digital advertising space.2.Secure Strategic Business Development Deals: Negotiate and close high-value deals with key clients, advertisers, and agencies to secure long-term partnerships and premium placements. Identify and pursue strategic partnerships, alliances, and business development opportunities that enhance our market position and drive revenue growth. 3.Optimize our sales force, overseeing people management of National Sales team and Local Sales team, dispersed across the US (combination of office and remote workers):Lead and develop the teams, fostering collaboration while respecting their unique approaches.Develop and implement sales strategies, processes, and training programs to optimize their productivity and effectiveness.Build a culture of accountability and high performance. Influence/collaborate and bring value with respect to strategic revenue operations decisions and execution including 2nd chance, e-mail cadences, and more. Influence/collaborate and bring value with respect to lead gen unit economics and optimization Work with marketing to ensure our products positioned the right way to the right clusters of clients, prospects 4.Drive Revenue Growth:Collaborate cross-functionally with marketing, operations, and finance teams to develop integrated revenue generation plans. Monitor key performance metrics, analyze sales data, and track progress against targets to identify areas for improvement and drive continuous revenue growth.5.Cultivate client relationships, partnering with customer success team:Build and maintain strong relationships with key clients in both National and Local markets, understanding their needs and objectives to deliver tailored solutions.Act as a trusted advisor and strategic partner, leveraging industry insights and market trends to drive mutual success.Collaborate with customer success to ensure post campaign reporting contains data sufficient to secure renewals. 6.Partner with Sales Operations and Enablement to enable technology and processes for the Sales team:Champion and implement efficient sales processes, tools, and systems to improve sales efficiency and effectiveness.Identify and implement best practices in sales enablement to ensure the continuous learning and development of the sales team partnering with the Sales Operations team7.Stay Ahead of Industry Trends:Monitor industry trends, market dynamics, and the competitive landscape to identify emerging opportunities and threats.Anticipate market shifts and proactively adapt revenue strategies to capitalize on new trends, technologies, and customer preferences.
Required Skills and Abilities:
Excellent sales leadership experience and communication skills with the ability to inspire, motivate, and guide high-performing, multi-channel, diverse, sales teams. You possess keen performance management skills, fostering a culture of continuous learning and development for your team members.A clear, concise, and persuasive communication style, with the ability to effectively communicate complex ideas to diverse audiences, both internally and externally.You command gravitas and presence, fostering trust and respect from your team, colleagues, and clients.Strategic leader, experience leading large-scale sales force, working in an ambiguous and entrepreneurial environment, willing to roll up sleeves and learn.Amazing people coaching and management skills with the ability to efficiently communicate and drive results across the organization.Excellent time management skills with the ability to hit deadlines and keep management informed. An analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data, analyze trends, and translate insights into actionable strategies and tactics.A strategic thinker with a proven track record of developing and executing data-driven revenue growth strategies. You are passionate about driving results and possess a relentless focus on continuous improvement.An operational and process-oriented mindset, with a passion for streamlining and optimizing existing processes to achieve greater efficiency and effectiveness.A “working general” mentality; someone who is in charge but is contributing with even more passion than the team, paving the way and inspiring the company’s work ethic and commitment to excellence.Strong expertise in CRM systems, with ability to manage systems to ensure accurate data capture and reporting of sales performance.

Minimum Required Education and Work Experience:
Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or a related field; MBA preferred.Proven track record of success in revenue generation, business development, and sales leadership roles within the outdoor advertising or media industry. A minimum of 3-5 years in a sales leadership position and 8+ years of total selling and/or business development experience is required.
Strong negotiation skills with a demonstrated ability to close complex, high-value deals with strategic partners and clients.
Culture Fit:
You are a collaborative and results-oriented individual who thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.You are passionate about the out-of-home advertising industry and the wellness industry, and possess a deep understanding of current trends and challenges.You are a strong advocate for building and maintaining a positive, inclusive, and high-performing company culture.
Physical Requirements:
This is a stationary position, with prolonged periods of sitting at a desk.This position will require prolonged periods of operating a computer/keyboard/mouse/monitor and other office productivity machinery such as a copy machine, computer printer, and telephone. The person in this position must occasionally move about the office to access office machinery or attend meetings.
Work is performed in a temperature-controlled environment, but employee may be required to travel to off-site meetings for business purposes.
Why Join Us:
Opportunity to lead revenue generation efforts for a leading advertising company with a strong reputation for innovation and excellence.Competitive salary, bonus and robust benefits package with opportunities for professional growth and development.Collaborative and dynamic work environment with a talented team of professionals dedicated to driving success.Make a significant impact by shaping the future of sponsored wellness advertising
If you are a strategic leader with a proven track record of success in driving revenue growth and maximizing sales team performance within the advertising industry, we invite you to apply for the position and join us on our journey of innovation and growth. Apply now to be part of our dynamic team!

Equal Employment Opportunity Policy: Our Company prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type and affords equal employment opportunities to employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Our Company conforms to the spirit as well as to the letter of all applicable laws and regulations.
Americans with Disabilities Act Policy: Our Company will reasonably accommodate qualified individuals with a disability so that they can perform the essential functions of a job unless doing so causes a direct threat to these individuals or others in the workplace and the threat cannot be eliminated by reasonable accommodation or if the accommodation creates an undue hardship to the Company. Contact the Human Resources Department with questions or requests for accommodation

title: Meeting and Event Planning Manager
description:
Northmarq – Minneapolis; Atlanta; Dallas; Denver; Phoenix 

At Northmarq, you can be part of something special. Northmarq is a unique capital markets resource for commercial real estate investors, providing our clients access to experts in debt, equity, investment sales, loan servicing, and fund management. We offer you a career path with best-in-class training, and we foster inclusive teams committed to collaboration, mentoring, and growth. At Northmarq, we will help you unlock your potential – whether you are an industry veteran or you’re just getting started. Your new career is waiting. Start something special today. Northmarq was voted by Real Estate Forum as one of The Best Places to Work in Commercial Real Estate! 

Northmarq is seeking a Meeting and Event Planning Manager to join the Marketing & Communications department. This individual will be responsible for all meetings and event strategies including attending events and speaking engagements. This critical role will lead the meetings and events function for the organization including planning, executing, and optimizing the delivery of internal meetings, recognition/incentive programs, external events, sponsorships, and trade shows for corporate and regional teams.

The position is an in-office position, and an immediate start date is required.Open to Minneapolis; Atlanta; Dallas; Denver; Phoenix - with Minneapolis, MN preferred

Position Responsibilities

 Ideate new events and client engagement programs to engage target audiences in value-added services, products, and programs to reinforce the brand value of NM.  Lead and support external client-facing events including conferences, forums, and round table discussions.  Develop efficient and repeatable event processes (concept to execution) to deliver an optimal event experience.  Travel to events, speaking engagements, and tradeshows often with senior leaders to coordinate details and represent the organization.  Research, recommend, and support external conferences and sponsorship opportunities.  Manage all aspects of events and sponsorships including planning, logistical management, coordination across business/stakeholders, programming, branding, and follow-up.  Propose new ideas to improve the event planning and implementation process, develop a measurement framework, and report on KPIs for each event.  Engage vendors and other support teams, negotiate contracts, develop meeting project plans and agendas, and coordinate onsite meeting implementation plans. 

What We're Looking For

 7+ years of meeting planning experience creating event and sponsorship strategies that deepen relationships and drive brand value.  Experience leading events in an organization with a national presence and driving value through local market strategies.  Bachelor’s degree in hospitality or business administration.  Experience with meeting registration and tracking systems, Microsoft Suite, and other technology to enable event management.  Ability to act as an ambassador and face of Northmarq to all internal and external attendees and stakeholders.  Ability to travel up to 50%. 

Northmarq offers a highly competitive benefits package including: medical, dental, vision, paid time off, 401K match and an annual discretionary contribution based on business performance, paid parental leave and adoption assistance, education assistance, volunteer paid time off, charitable contribution match and so much more!

title: Propulsion CFD Analyst
description:
At Blue Origin, we envision millions of people living and working in space for the benefit of Earth. We’re working to develop reusable, safe, and low-cost space vehicles and systems within a culture of safety, collaboration, and inclusion. Join our diverse team of problem solvers as we add new chapters to the history of spaceflight! 

This role is part of the Blue Origin Engines business unit, where our focus is the design, development, manufacturing, and testing of engines and propulsion systems. Built for multiple uses, our family of engines is powering the next generation of rockets for commercial, civil, national security, and human spaceflight.

As part of a hardworking team of diverse engineers, you will provide fluid analyses for various liquid rocket engines with focus on fluid dynamics modeling of engine components. The fluid dynamics analysis team contributes to the design and test support of all Blue Origin rocket engines. This is an opportunity to demonstrate your fluid dynamics knowledge and grow in the profession by using computational fluid dynamics (CFD) as a tool.

The team is focused on high Reynolds number internal RANS/URANS flow problems solved with multi-processor computers. This job will expose you to several physical sub-modeling processes like complex thermodynamics properties, combustion, and cavitation. In this role you will be primarily supporting the design process by determining fluid environments using CFD and other analysis tools. You will interact with designers and other analysts to ensure our rocket components meet design requirements. This is an opportunity to work in a diverse group of experts analyzing challenging problems.

We are looking for someone to apply their technical expertise, organization skills, and commitment to quality to positively impact safe human spaceflight. Passion for our mission and vision is required!

Responsibilities Include But Are Not Limited To

Evaluating rocket engine component designs to evaluate level of analysis neededBuilding three dimensional models of components including grid generation, boundary conditions definition and solution methodology.Interrogate solutions to ensure modeling accuracy and to provide engineering values, and trends to meet customer needs.Document analysis process and results. Communicate understanding to broader engineering audience.

Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in engineering or a relevant technical field.2+ years of experience in fluids analysis using CFD.Knowledgeable in CFD theory including numerics, boundary condition types, and turbulence models.Ability to work effectively in teams with high quality documentation.Ability to earn trust, maintain positive and professional relationships, and strengthen our culture of inclusion.Must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.

Preferred Qualifications

Master’s degree in engineering or relevant technical field.Experience in rocket industry.Experience with research level CFD modeling.Good understanding of liquid rocket theory and component requirements.Knowledge of commercial CFD analysis packages, CFD++ and/or CRUNCH CFD.Experience with solving CFD models using large (100-1000’s+ CPU cores) parrel computers.

Compensation range for on site WA applicants is $89,820-$125,748

Compensation range for on site CA applicants is $89,820-$125,748

Other Site Ranges May Differ

title: Propulsion Test Engineer II - Blue Engines - MSFC
description:
At Blue Origin, we envision millions of people living and working in space for the benefit of Earth. We’re working to develop reusable, safe, and low-cost space vehicles and systems within a culture of safety, collaboration, and inclusion. Join our diverse team of problem solvers as we add new chapters to the history of spaceflight! 

At Blue Origin, we envision millions of people living and working in space for the benefit of Earth. We’re working to develop reusable, safe, and low-cost space vehicles and systems within a culture of safety, collaboration, and inclusion. Join our diverse team of problem solvers as we add new chapters to the history of spaceflight! 

We are a diverse team of collaborators, doers, and problem-solvers who are relentlessly committed to a culture of safety. Would you like to help define the future of human space flight and have a direct impact on how commercial space builds the infrastructure for the future space industry? Join us in lowering the cost of access to space while enabling Blue Origin’s vision of millions of people living and working in space to benefit Earth.

This role is part of the Blue Origin Engines business unit, where our focus is the design, development, manufacturing and testing of engines and propulsion systems. Built for multiple uses, our family of engines is powering the next generation of rockets for commercial, civil, national security and human spaceflight.

As part of a small, passionate, and driven team of propulsion test engineers, you will be responsible for carrying out test operations to meet program objectives for the current and future generations of Blue Origin engines. This role is based in Huntsville, AL. Our teams believe in continuous improvement of ourselves and our colleagues as we train and develop each other into our defined roles. In this role you will directly contribute to engine test operations by assisting with test planning and execution, risk identification and mitigation, hardware integration for test campaigns, post-test inspections, data review, and engine performance analysis. You will help identify and improve non-conforming test hardware while you also establish processes that promote efficient and reliable testing. This position will directly have a hand in defining the future of rocket engine development and thereby space exploration and will require your dedicated commitment and detailed attention towards safe and repeatable spaceflight.

We are looking for driven life-long learners that can apply and hone their technical expertise, leadership skills, emotional intelligence, and dedication to quality, to positively impact the future of safe human spaceflight. Passion for our mission and vision, along with inclusive and diverse values are required!

Qualifications

B.S. degree in Engineering (aerospace, mechanical, or physics desired)2-3 years experience in a rocket engine testing or equivalent industryAbility to earn trust, maintain positive and professional relationships, and contribute to a culture of inclusionExperience in writing and executing test proceduresProven experience in data review and analysisWork On-site at Marshall Space Flight Center Test Stand 4670, Huntsville, ALDemonstrated ability to lead projects and work independentlyStrong technical fundamentals in fluids and thermodynamicsExperience in troubleshooting instrumentation and fluid system componentsAbility to read and interpret engineering standards, technical requirements, and engineering drawingsStrong written and verbal communication skillsMust be a U.S. citizen or national U.S. permanent resident (current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.

Desired

M.S. degree or higher in mechanical or aerospace engineering with experimental lab experienceLiquid rocket engine test experienceHands-on experience integrating test articles and sub-assemblies for testExperience in designing, fabricating, and operating complex fluid systemsKnowledge of data acquisition systems and test instrumentation including pressure transducers, thermocouples, silicon diodes, resistance temperature detectors, flow meters, load cells and accelerometers.Experience in identifying and rectifying non-conforming hardwareOperational Understanding of engines and engine sub-components, such as turbopumps, combustion devices, valves, and other fluid componentsExperience with hazard and risk analysisFamiliarity with LabVIEW, MATLAB, Winplot, or other control, data acquisition, and reduction softwareFamiliarity with CAD applications (ProE or Creo preferred)

title: Valve Design Lead Principle Engineer - Lunar Permanence
description:
At Blue Origin, we envision millions of people living and working in space for the benefit of Earth. We’re working to develop reusable, safe, and low-cost space vehicles and systems within a culture of safety, collaboration, and inclusion. Join our diverse team of problem solvers as we add new chapters to the history of spaceflight! 

This role is part of the Lunar Transportation business unit, which develops Blue Origin’s multiple Blue Moon lander product lines. To further Blue Origin's mission of having millions of people living and working in space, we are building sustainable infrastructure for our transport of crew and cargo from Earth to the lunar surface.

We are a diverse team of collaborators, doers, and problem-solvers who are relentlessly committed to a culture of safety. This position will directly impact the history of space exploration and will require your dedication and detailed attention towards safe and repeatable space flight. Join us in lowering the cost of access to space and enabling Blue Origin’s vision of millions of people living and working in space to benefit Earth. We are looking for a Valve Design Lead Principal on Lunar Transportation. You will provide technical leadership to a team tasked to develop, build, test and deliver high performing valves in a Lunar Fluid System. We will work on the complete life cycle of the system from definition, interfaces, conceptual design, detailed design, component development, assembly, verification, and operation. As part of your role, you will mentor & train other team members on a growing team. You will become an expert in the valves from raw materials through operational life on a human rated lunar systems. Your knowledge will help you to generate clean sheet valve design options, lead trade studies, surface opportunities and risks, and chart an iterative path to an optimized valve design that will be crucial to this and future generations of spaceflight.

Bring your technical expertise, leadership skills, and dedication to quality to positively impact safe human spaceflight. Passion for our mission and vision is required!

Qualifications

B.S. in Aerospace, Electrical, Mechanical, Physics, Systems Engineering or related technical subject area15+ years of experience in fluids and mechanical systems/componentsExperience with valve design, GD&T, DFMAExperience developing, integrating, and certifying aerospace hardware for flightDemonstrated ability to provide technical leadership of a teamBasic cost, schedule, resource, and scope management skillsExcellent verbal, written, and graphical communication skillsAbility to earn trust, maintain positive and professional relationships, and contribute to a culture of inclusionMust be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum

Desired

M.S. or Ph. D in Aerospace, Electrical, Mechanical, Physics, Systems Engineering or related technical subject areaCryogenic/Two phase fluids experienceExperience designing for launch vehicle and spacecraft applicationsExperience with the entire life cycle from initial concept design to end of life

title: Marketing Campaigns and Operations Associate
description:
Compensation Range: 80-90k base + 10% (Depending on Experience)

This role can be remote anywhere in the US

What will you do?

We're seeking a highly motivated and experienced Marketing Campaigns and Operations Associate to join our dynamic team. Here, you'll spearhead the development of campaign deliverables, collaborate and strategize with our Brand and Digital teams, and oversee the daily operations of our campaigns. You'll closely partner with the marketing and sales teams to ensure accurate metric tracking, establish streamlined processes, and ensure timely delivery of key initiatives.

Responsibilities

Create campaign deliverables and assets by collaborating with internal team members and vendors, effectively utilizing our resources, tools, and strategic processes. Assist in managing vendor relationships and strategic partners to ensure timelines, work quality, and project goals are met. Simultaneously, they will be responsible for reporting back to our team with updates and strategic solutions. Collaborate with the Associate Content Marketer & Copywriter to develop messaging, designs, and new campaign concepts, creating compelling campaigns that engage buyers at every stage of the sales funnel. Support our Digital team with our ABM strategy by assisting in creating ad assets, TTA landing pages, and strategic messaging aligned with our SEO strategy. Contribute to planning our in-person events, including venue sourcing, email development, landing pages and vendor relationship management. Oversee our webinar platform, including content production, webinar hosting, vendor management (if using third parties), poll setup, and slide deck formatting with assistance from presenters. Demonstrate an understanding of creating evergreen campaigns and content. Implement email marketing best practices, possess relevant knowledge of social media trends, and have intermediate design skills/creativity. Conduct A/B testing to optimize events and campaigns traffic, engagement, and conversion tactics. Collaborate closely with the sales enablement team to enhance our processes, detailed documentation, and training for the smarketing (sales and marketing) team. Establish a close relationship with the sales team to ensure all leads and contacts are appropriately reported and maintain clean Salesforce hygiene. Bring forward-thinking, out-of-the-box ideas to the team to enhance our campaign landing, branding, and expansion efforts. Optimize and create internal and cross department marketing operations processes. 

What You Bring

Bachelor's degree in marketing, business, or a related field; relevant certifications are a plus. 2-3 years of experience in marketing, or a related role, preferably in the SaaS or technology industry. Preferred experience working with HubSpot, Salesforce, Asana, and Canva. (Nice-to-have but not required experience using 6sense, Mutiny, Confluence, and Seismic). Assist in creating and implementing new campaign processes, documenting these processes, and enhancing internal adoption. Maintain a mindset geared towards solutions and view challenges as chances for personal growth. For any problems that arise, it will be up to you to present your thoughts, find creative solutions, and execute. Ability to effectively operate and produce results in a scale-up environment. Must have rock-solid project management skills, execute within deadlines, and possess a keen eye for attention to detail. 

Total Rewards! 

We want to make sure our employees feel valued and taken care of. Come join us and see for yourself!

20 Days PTO12 HolidaysSummer Half-Day FridaysCompany provided equipment401K with company matchFSA/HSA optionsPaid Parental Leave & Reintegration ProgramEmployee Wellness Program for personal, financial, emotional, & legal support to help keep our team happy, healthy, and thrivingMedical, Dental, Vision Coverage4 Week (1 Month) Sabbatical to recharge and return even stronger

We are Focused Owners Innovating with Integrity & Respect

At Quid, we believe in a people-centric culture - where integrity, respect, and innovation are at the forefront. We celebrate and appreciate individuals from all walks of life, backgrounds, and perspectives, which creates a dynamic environment where everyone can thrive, contribute their unique ideas, and be respected for who they are. We're super proud of our inclusive hiring practices that promote diversity and bring in all kinds of unique perspectives. After all, we're an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and we truly believe that our team is strongest when we're made up of people with all kinds of different skills, knowledge, and potential. We're committed to cultivating a diverse and inclusive workplace, where integrity guides our actions, respect forms the foundation of our interactions, and innovation flourishes through unique minds working together.

Still Not Sure?

We understand many candidates tend to only apply for jobs if they meet every single requirement listed. However, if you happen to be genuinely enthusiastic about this particular position and feel confident in your ability to excel at it, we strongly urge you to submit your application! You might just be the perfect fit for this role, or even another exciting opportunity within our company.

This position is not eligible for immigration sponsorship (e.g., new H-1B visa sponsorship, transfer of existing H-1B visa, E-3 visa petition, etc.). All applicants for this position must have current and permanent legal authorization to work in the U.S. without sponsorship for employment visa status.

Remote Work!

Remote-first; We're thrilled to say that we've been passionate about remote work since day one! Being remote is simply who we are. At Quid, we're all about connecting with people from all corners of the globe. Our team is made up of individuals who are comfortable working remotely and collaborating with others across different time zones.

title: Supply Chain Supervisor- Replenishment Execution Stores,
description:
We have a message to get out: we’re growing. Fast. ALDI is one of the fastest-growing retailers in the nation and we are charting an aggressive growth course to become one of the top 3 grocery retailers in the US. That’s why we need dedicated people to navigate the supply chain challenges. As we expand, this is your chance to join a team where your hard work is guaranteed to make a difference. The objective of this role is to manage and administer ALDI Supply Chain programs by economically securing product for the business, which in turn, promotes the company’s objectives of maximizing sales and controlling expenses. In addition, the position will assist with the advancement of numerous Supply Chain initiatives in accordance with company guidelines.

As a Supply Chain Supervisor on the Replenishment Execution Stores Team, you will be responsible for driving company initiatives and creating new ways of working. You will be the heart of a collaborative network of Supply Chain teams who will strive to better support business operations on a daily basis. The ideal candidate will have a background or education in Supply Chain Management, an innovative and creative mindset and the ability to move a team forward on a variety of projects. This role will be responsible for a rapidly growing team that is equipped to impact the advancement of overarching company goals. With a thriving organization like ours, this can make for a rewarding career.

Position Type: Full-Time

Work Location: Batavia, IL

This role is eligible to participate in ALDI’s Hybrid Work Program, which allows remote work up to 3 days per week (i.e., work remotely up to 3 days per week; work in-office at least 2 days per week).

Duties And Responsibilities

Must be able to perform duties with or without reasonable accommodation.

 Identifies and implements best practices within the scope of their responsibilities utilizing insights from qualitative and quantitative data. Establishes communicates and evaluates job responsibilities and performance expectations to their direct reports to ensure mutual understanding and desired results. Identifies training and development opportunities that will assist their direct reports in achieving enhanced performance. Understands the overarching company strategy while communicating and modeling the core values of the organization to create a sense of teamwork and membership among employees. Proposes changes to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of Supply Chain processes, strategies, and tactics; communicates approved changes to direct reports. Works closely with subject matter experts to develop and contribute to training documentations, speeches, presentations, videos and other communication materials relevant to current business opportunities. Provides input to their direct leader on hiring for positions reporting to them. Informs management of major team milestones, developments, and concerns. Provides coverage for colleagues where necessary. Anticipates, mediates and deescalates conflicts proactively. Serves as the secondary link, behind Manager, between their team’s staff and leadership to assure understanding of company goals, objectives, and opportunities for improvement. Ensures compliance with all company policies and procedures within their area of responsibility and conducts internal audits where requested. Ensures team strategies are aligned with department strategies. Ensures that all documentation in their area of responsibility is archived and disposed of properly. Analyzes work procedures with the objective of driving simplicity through best practices without sacrificing effectiveness. Provides daily direction, assistance, and communication to internal teams, agencies, and vendors. Provides support to their department, divisions, and stores; contacts appropriate internal personnel or external vendors when further expertise is required. Supervises the day-to-day operations of their team, escalating issues to the appropriate level of support and/or leadership when necessary. Ensures direct reports complete assigned responsibilities in a timely and effective manner to provide the highest level of customer service for the business. Complies with ALDI privacy and security requirements and policies if job responsibilities include possible access to confidential and/or sensitive information. Other duties as assigned.

Knowledge/Skills/Abilities

Job-specific Competencies:

 Consistently demonstrates the Mindsets, ALDI Acts Competencies and Professional Skills (M.A.P.) as outlined for the role. Gives attention to detail and follows instruction. Ability to develop rapport, trust, and open communication that enhances the growth and performance of direct reports. Conflict management skills. Problem-solving skills. Understands the history, strategy, organizational authority, interdependence of job duties, products, systems, and services of the company. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Prepares written materials to meet purpose and audience. Ability to quickly learn new systems and analytical tools. Ability to influence business decisions and provide fact-based recommendations. Ability to thrive in a fast-paced work environment, consistently meeting deadlines and remaining calm under pressure. Knowledge of products and services of the company. Ability to facilitate group involvement when conducting meetings.

Education And Experience

 Bachelor's Degree in Business, Supply Chain or a related field required. A minimum of 3 years of progressive experience in Supply Chain required. Or, a combination of education and experience providing equivalent knowledge. Relevant ALDI business experience with an exceptional level of demonstrated success required. SAP experience preferred.

Physical Requirements

 Work may be performed in an office, remote office or a combination of both where a computer and office equipment may be used as needed to perform duties. Regularly required to sit, reach, grasp, stand and move from one area to another. Constantly and repeatedly use keyboard/mouse. Occasionally required to push, pull, bend, lift and move up to 25 lbs.

Travel

 Minimal travel required as needed for job related duties such as training, project work and administrative tasks.

title: Process Engineer
description:
ABOUT USByFusion is committed to decarbonizing the planet by solving the global plastic crisis - locally!
Recognized by Fast Company, The New York Times, US Green Building Council Net Zero Accelerator, B Corps Best for the World, 1% for the Planet’s Innovation of the Year, Waste Dive’s ‘Most Disruptive Innovation of the Year’, and an essential cog in the wheel of circular economy, our systems convert all types of waste plastic – including marine debris and fishing nets – into an advanced building material called ByBlock® that enables communities, corporations, and governments to block plastic waste for good!
ByFusion believes Earth and our team are our most valuable resources. We are dedicated to promoting diversity, multiculturalism, and inclusion throughout our company. We are fully focused on equality and believe deeply in diversity of race, gender, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, national origin, and all the other fascinating characteristics that make us different. Our relatively flat organizational structure keeps everyone informed and enables people to get involved in solving the problems they care about most.
ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITYAs a Manufacturing Process Engineer, you will play a key role in optimizing and improving our manufacturing processes to enhance efficiency, quality, and productivity. This role will be responsible for the design, installation, and start-up of our new manufacturing facility in Tucson, AZ. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, both internal and external to ByFusion, to manufacture machine components and lead the installation and start-up of the system. You’ll also be responsible for building layout and infrastructure needs and scope for this greenfield installation. 
**This role will be based in Tucson, AZ, long-term, but will start with either location or travel to our Gardena, CA, facility.**
You must be passionate about the environment and making a difference globally, as this is the foundation of our work.
RESPONSIBILITIESLead the planning and execution of the installation and start-up of new manufacturing lines in Tucson, AZ.Assist in machine and process design to improve the overall quality and efficiency of the process.Coordinate with equipment vendors, contractors, and internal teams to ensure timely delivery, installation, and integration of machinery and systems.Conduct thorough site assessments and risk assessments to identify potential challenges and develop mitigation strategies.Develop detailed installation plans, schedules, and budgets and ensure adherence to project timelines and budgetary constraints.Oversee equipment installation, alignment, calibration, and validation activities to ensure compliance with technical specifications and regulatory requirements.Develop and implement start-up procedures and protocols, including equipment commissioning, performance testing, and operator training.Troubleshoot equipment and process issues during start-up and ramp-up phases and implement corrective actions to minimize downtime and maximize productivity.Document installation and start-up activities, including equipment specifications, drawings, test results, and standard operating procedures.Provide technical support and training to the production team to ensure smooth operation and maintenance of the new manufacturing line.Drive innovation through emerging technologies in manufacturing processes and equipment.
QUALIFICATIONSBachelor's degree in Engineering (Mechanical, Chemical, Manufacturing, or related field). 2+ years of related experience in a manufacturing environmentStrong understanding of manufacturing processes, including machining, assembly, welding, and finishing.Thrives in a fast-paced team environment. Project management skills.Strong organizational and time management skills.Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively in a cross-functional team environment.Must be able to embrace new ideas and concepts for the betterment of product development, the production process, and building.Strong relationship-building skills – both internal and external.
PREFERRED SKILLSExperience with Solidworks or similar modeling softwareExperience with capital equipment procurementExperience with facility improvements and upgradesExperience with actuators and control systems
POSITION & LOCATIONThis role is a full-time position that will be based in Tucson, AZ long-term, but will start with either location or travel to our Gardena, CA facility. 
BENEFITSHealth benefits, Unlimited PTO, company holidays, and equity.

title: Senior Account Manager
description:
Compensation Range: $200,000-225,000 OTE (Base + Commission)

This role can be remote anywhere in the US.     

Become one of the changemakers. At Quid, you won’t just be joining a team but contributing to a culture of innovation, where every challenge becomes an opportunity to learn and grow. When you join our team, you’re not just stepping into a job, you’re embracing a future where we lead the game with the unmatched advantage of foresight.

Position Overview

The key focus of the Senior Account Manager is to drive revenue by developing and managing relationships with the existing Enterprise customer base. The Enterprise customer base includes Top Tier Market Research Firms, Consultancies, and other Enterprise accounts. This position will drive multiple transactions within this customer base. The incumbent will apply solid business-to-business sales and account management experience to consistently meet quotas and reap the compensation benefits for doing so.

Role Objectives

Carry and exceed growth quota by negotiating contracts, upselling, and cross-selling Quid’s Consumer Intelligence platform suite.  Drive year over year revenue retention and growth through successful use of existing and new client solutions.  Establish and maintain client relationships with a strategic focus and deal with tactical issues driven by client needs.  Identify and assess client business drivers to provide product solutions through a consultative approach.  Leverage highly satisfied clients to promote our brand and solution.  Manage client relationships in the form of business reviews or follow up meetings to enhance customer relationships.  Develop accurate forecasting and account plans, quarterly account reviews and associated internal reporting requirements to demonstrate client relationship progression.  Provide daily accurate forecasts to the sales organization and executive management  

Requirements

High-energy, driven and goal-oriented Account Manager with a history of selling to top-tier brands and challenging status quo.   A demonstrated track record of getting into an undefined space  Track record of understanding product and ideas quickly and then applying those to prospects and client use cases  Comfortable discussing pricing, budget and business value of a premium product.  Exceptional communications and presentation skills to consistently influence and persuade clients including client follow-up  A positive, self-starter attitude and desire to exceed expectations at every opportunity  Ability to work in a fast pace, innovative, team environment   5 -10 years of quota carrying software (SaaS experience preferred) or technology sales and account management experience  Consistent earnings in past Account Executive or Account Management quota carrying roles  Track record of over-achieving quota (top 10-20% of company) in past positions   Experience managing and closing complex sales-cycles   Sales Methodology training, marketing applications experience, and strong customer references preferred   Strong computer skills, including Salesforce.com and the Microsoft suite including Teams, Outlook, Word, Excel, SharePoint & PowerPoint. Experience with Gong, Scratchpad, & Looker a plus.   Bachelor or University Degree 

Total Rewards!    

We want to make sure our employees feel valued and taken care of. Come join us and see for yourself!   

20 Days PTO    12 Holidays    Summer Half-Day Fridays    Company provided equipment.    401K with company match    FSA/HSA options    Paid Parental Leave & Reintegration Program    Employee Wellness Program for personal, financial, emotional, & legal support to help keep our team happy, healthy, and thriving.    Medical, Dental, Vision Coverage    4 Week (1 Month) Sabbatical after five years 

Still Not Sure?   

We understand many candidates tend to only apply for jobs if they meet every single requirement listed. However, if you happen to be genuinely enthusiastic about this particular position and feel confident in your ability to excel at it, we strongly urge you to submit your application! You might just be the perfect fit for this role, or even another exciting opportunity within our company.

Remote Work!   

Remote-first; We're thrilled to say that we've been passionate about remote work since day one! Being remote is simply who we are. At Quid, we're all about connecting with people from all corners of the globe. Our team is made up of individuals who are comfortable working remotely and collaborating with others across different time zones.

This position is not eligible for immigration sponsorship (e.g., new H-1B visa sponsorship, transfer of existing H-1B visa, E-3 visa petition, etc.). All applicants for this position must have current and permanent legal authorization to work in the U.S. without sponsorship for employment visa status.

About Quid 

Our product suite uses advanced artificial intelligence to process billions of indexed resources across all forms of structured and unstructured data, empowering brand, agency, and consulting services customers to make smart, data-drive decisions accurately, quickly, and efficiently.

title: Content Marketer and Copywriter Associate
description:
Compensation Range: 80-90k base + 10% (Depending on Experience)

This role can be remote anywhere in the US

Position Overview

As a Content Marketer & Copywriter Associate, you will play a pivotal role in shaping and executing our content marketing strategy. You will collaborate closely with the marketing team and other departments to develop engaging and compelling content with consistent and persuasive messaging across diverse marketing platforms. This includes crafting blog posts, social media content, event materials, ad copy, and more, that engage our target audience.

We’re looking for candidates with experience developing content as a Content Marketer / Copywriter or a similar role—B2B SaaS and Tech experience is a plus. The ideal candidate should also be familiar with creating content that aligns with SEO best practices and data-driven insights. This role will report to the Senior Brand and Content Manager.

Role Objectives

Create high-quality, impactful, and SEO-driven written content, including blogs, website copy, paid advertisements, social media posts, presentations, infographics, white papers, articles, etc. designed to capture diverse target audiences and contribute to retention/acquisition strategies. Create visually impactful and creative content (ads, visuals for landing pages, templates, GIF) using a available tools including Canva and ceros. Collaborate and foster relationships amongst the wider marketing team and other cross-functional teams to ensure clarity, consistency, and brand alignment in all produced content. Participate actively in strategic and creative brainstorming sessions, contributing fresh ideas and inspiring innovation. Assist in the development of content calendars and schedules to ensure consistent delivery of content. Own the day-to-day management of social media as a key stakeholder in the social media process and tracking performance. Conduct research to understand industry trends, customer needs, and competitor strategies to inform content creation. Monitor and analyze the performance of content initiatives to make data-driven decisions and optimize future content efforts. 

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, English, or related field. 2-3 years of proven experience in content marketing, copywriting, or a related role, preferably in the SaaS or technology industry. Exceptional copywriting and editing skills with a keen eye for detail. Experience collaborating with multiple teams and job functions. Strong designs skills – you love to create new visual content and have affinity for visually impactful digital visual content. (including short videos and GIF created with user friendly like canva.) Strong understanding of content marketing principles, including SEO, social media, and email marketing. Ability to adapt writing style to different audiences, brands, and channels. Creative thinker with the ability to generate innovative ideas and solutions. 

Preferred Skills & Experience

Understanding of how to leverage technology in marketing processes, including marketing automation, HubSpot, Canva, and SEO tools (e.g., Google Analytics, SEMrush) and webinar tools. Graphic design experience and the ability to use platforms like Photoshop, Lightroom & Illustrator are a plus. 

Total Rewards!

We celebrate and appreciate individuals from all walks of life, backgrounds, and perspectives, which creates a dynamic environment where everyone can thrive, contribute their unique ideas, and be respected for who they are. We're super proud of our inclusive hiring practices that promote diversity and bring in all kinds of unique perspectives. After all, we're an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and we truly believe that our team is strongest when we're made up of people with all kinds of different skills, knowledge, and potential. We're committed to cultivating a diverse and inclusive workplace, where integrity guides our actions, respect forms the foundation of our interactions, and innovation flourishes through unique minds working together.

Remote-first; We're thrilled to say that we've been passionate about remote work since day one! Being remote is simply who we are. title: SLD Fluids Design Engineer - Lunar Transportation
description:
At Blue Origin, we envision millions of people living and working in space for the benefit of Earth. We’re working to develop reusable, safe, and low-cost space vehicles and systems within a culture of safety, collaboration, and inclusion. Join our diverse team of problem solvers as we add new chapters to the history of spaceflight! 

This role is part of the Lunar Transportation business unit. To further Blue Origin's mission of having millions of people living and working in space, we are building the sustainable infrastructure for our transport of crew and cargo from earth to the Lunar Surface.

We are looking for multiple fluids propulsion and mechanical design engineers. You will design the propulsion and/or fluid systems for Lunar spacecraft. Work will include the complete life cycle of the system from definition, interfaces, conceptual design, detailed design, component development, assembly, verification, and operation. You will own your components from initial design to analyzing data from their landing on the moon!

You will understand and contribute to flight piping and instrumentation diagrams and schematics. You will design and perform 1st order analyses to verify your designs. You will work with suppliers or Blue Origin groups to identify and procure components. You will build Lunar vehicles in CAD by modeling valves, propulsion elements, sensors, piping, and other equipment in the flight vehicle. You will size, select material, and analyze piping and supporting structure for structural integrity due to pressure, vibration, fracture, fatigue, etc. You will manage suppliers and other support to procure, fabricate, and install flight hardware. You will create and manage the project plans for various hardware including cost and schedule. You may mentor entry level engineers and perform technical peer reviews.

Bring your technical expertise, leadership skills, and dedication to quality to positively impact safe human spaceflight. Passion for our mission and vision is required!

You will work directly with NASA and our National Team Partners as part of the Human Landing System (HLS) Sustaining Lunar Development (SLD) program. You will play a key role in developing the Lunar Transportation system that will return humans to the Moon and extend human presence permanently beyond the bounds of Earth.

Minimum Qualifcations

B.S. degree in Mechanical, Aerospace, or related field5+ years of experience in aerospace propulsion and fluid analysis and piping design including process component selection and process fluid design architectureKnowledge of propulsion and fluid system components (i.e. valves, regulators and pumps for cryogenics, propellants, and other fluids)Experience performing the structural and fluid design and analysis of piping and tubing systems; and using analysis tools such as ANSYS, Thermal Desktop.Experience interpreting and generating Piping and Instrumentation Diagrams (P&IDs)Experience creating fabrication and installation drawings with ProEngineer/CreoAbility to earn trust, maintain positive and professional relationships, and contribute to a culture of collaboration and inclusionMust be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience with ProEngineer/Creo, Windchill, and ProPipingKnowledge of standard installation and fabrication methods of piping systems (tube stock, fittings, connections, fasteners, welding, etc.)Advanced Engineering degreeExperience with static and non-linear FEA analysis (ANSYS)

Compensation range for on site CO applicants is $102,383-$143,335

Compensation range for on site WA applicants is $111,690-$156,366

Compensation range for on site CA applicants is $111,690-$156,366
